definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: This yoga ancient books has a very clear explanation.
sentences.chinese: 这在瑜伽古书中已经交代的非常明确了。

sentences.english: Chen and Tian ancient sound similar, it is often for Ancient Tin.
sentences.chinese: 陈与田古音相近，故古书往往作田。

sentences.english: Don't damage these ancient books;I shall not be able to replace them.
sentences.chinese: 别把这些古书弄坏了，我可赔不起。

sentences.english: He delves into lots of old books and papers for the fact.
sentences.chinese: 他钻研许多古书与文件，以寻找事实。

sentences.english: In this way, when can we judge the whole ancient books to read, comprehend by analogy.
sentences.chinese: 这样，阅读古书时才能举一反三，触类旁通。

sentences.english: Recorded in ancient books see the Dragon represents a good omen and saw the snake is drought disaster.
sentences.chinese: 古书记载，看龙代表好兆头，又见蛇，是大旱。

sentences.english: The symptoms were described in ancient writings.
sentences.chinese: 古书描述了此病的具体症状。

sentences.english: Collect the lost ancient book, tell truth from falsehood; Keeping three respects to contemporary documents.
sentences.chinese: 辑佚古书，辨别真伪及对当代文献的保留三个方面。

sentences.english: The Gospel was one of three texts bound together in a codex, or ancient book.
sentences.chinese: 这本福音书是三份装订在一起的古书中的一份。

sentences.english: Only a fragment of the ancient book remains now.
sentences.chinese: 那古书现在只剩下一点残卷了。

sentences.english: Thisancient text holds the keys to victory in war and life.
sentences.chinese: 这本古书掌握着在战争和生存中取胜的关键。

sentences.english: Plus, it's stringed, like traditional books.
sentences.chinese: 而且是用线装的，很像古书。

sentences.english: All these ancient books and paintings have been marked up.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些古书古画都标了价。

sentences.english: Show me your image in some antique book.
sentences.chinese: 在古书里对我显示你的肖像。

sentences.english: However, one day he was found in the library of an ancient books.
sentences.chinese: 但是，有一天他在图书馆内发现了一本古书。

sentences.english: Many years ago, Mandi went around in those villages out of the way collecting title deed for land.
sentences.chinese: 十几年前，壹霖开始狂走偏僻村落，收罗地契古书。

definition: imperial edict/heavenly book (superstition)/obscure or illegible writing/double dutch
the distant past/ancient times/antiquity/early historical times
a book on the art of war
Baopuzi, collection of essays by Ge Hong 葛洪[Ge3 Hong2] on alchemy, immortality, legalism, society etc
great emptiness/the void/heaven/the skies/universe/cosmos/original essence of the cosmos
Lu Yu (733-804), Chinese writer from Tang dynasty, known for his obsession with tea
